questions.text: A patient is undergoing preanesthetic evaluation. He Is seated upright with the head neutral, mouth open, tongue protruded, and no phonation. The image of the mouth is given below. Which class does he belong to according to the modified Mallampati score?
questions.solution:
Correct Answer (D)

Class I
In the given image, the faucial pillars, uvula, and the soft palate are all visible. Therefore, this patient is classified as class I according to the modified Mallampati score. The modified Mallampati score is used to assess the difficulty of endotracheal intubation in a patient.

questions.text: A 6-year-old child with ventricular septal defect is posted for corrective surgery. Which of the following is the inhalational agent of choice for induction in this procedure?
questions.solution:
Correct Answer (B)

Sevoflurane

In the given clinical scenario of a child undergoing cardiac surgery, sevoflurane is the inhalational agent of choice for induction.

questions.text: Which intravenous anesthetic is associated with adreno-cortical suppression?
questions.solution:
Correct Answer (C)

Etomidate

Etomidate has been associated with adrenocortical suppression which can last for 72 hours.

questions.text: A 45-year-old man was posted for open inguinal hernia repair. He is a known hypertensive for the past 6 years and is poorly controlled on medications. Which of the following muscle relaxant can exacerbate hypertension in this patient?
questions.solution:
Correct Answer (A)

Pancuronium
Pancuronium can exacerbate hypertension in poorly controlled patients by inducing vagal blockade and neural release of catecholamine leading to sympathetic stimulation.

questions.text: Which of the following is not an intravenous induction agent?
questions.solution:
Correct Answer (D)

Halothane
Halothane is an inhalational agent which is a halogenated alkane. Induction with halothane is relatively slow due to its high blood: gas partition coefficient (2.5).

questions.text: Which of the following undergoes Hofmann elimination?
questions.solution:
Correct Answer (D)

Atracurium

Atracurium undergoes Hofmann elimination, which is spontaneous non-enzymatic degradation.

questions.text: Which among the following drugs is not a component of ACLS guidelines?
questions.solution:
Correct Answer (C)

Sodium bicarbonate

Sodium bicarbonate injection is not a part of ACLS guidelines.

questions.text: A patient who is under general anaesthesia shows the following finding on the ET CO2 monitor. Which condition can lead to this characteristic waveform on capnography?
questions.solution:
Correct Answer (B)

Bronchospasm

The above capnographic waveform depicts bronchospasm. Shark fin appearance Prolonged phase II, increased a angle, and steeper phase III suggest bronchospasm or airway obstruction.

questions.text: During a preoperative anesthetic evaluation, pharmacologic stress echocardiography is being undertaken for a patient with chronic pulmonary disease. Which of the following agents can be used for inducing pharmacological stress in this patient?
questions.solution:
Correct Answer (B)

Dobutamine

Dobutamine can be used for the induction of pharmacological stress in a patient with chronic pulmonary disease.

questions.text: A 28-year-old is admitted to the ER after being involved in a road traffic accident. Which type of IV cannula would achieve the maximum flow rate to provide fluid resuscitation?
questions.solution:
Correct Answer (A)

Orange

The orange cannula (14 Gauge) has the maximum flow rate of 270 mL/min.

questions.text: Which among the following IV anesthetics does not cause myocardial depression?
questions.solution:
Correct Answer (A)

Etomidate, a short-acting I.V. anesthetic agent doesn't cause myocardial depression.

questions.text: Which of the inhalational anesthetic uses special vaporizer?
questions.solution:
Correct Answer (A)

Desflurane 

Desflurane has special physical properties. It has a very high vapour pressure ( 660 mmhg) and a very low boiling point ( 23.5 deg Celsius). Due to this, it cant be delivered precisely using a conventional vaporizer and so we use a special vaporizer for delivering desflurane called as TEC 6 vaporizer.

questions.text: A person was given a muscle relaxant that competitively blocks nicotinic receptors. Which of the following drug is used for reversal of muscle relaxation after surgery?
questions.solution:
Correct Answer (A)

Neostigmine

Neuromuscular blocker divided in competitive (nondepolarizing) and noncompetitive (depolarizing). Reversal of competitive (nondepolarizing) is done by neostigmine + glycopyrrolate combination.

questions.text: A 62 years old patient with uncontrolled hypertension resulting in ruptured aortic aneurysm, submitted to surgery belongs to ASA class:
questions.solution:
Correct Answer (B)

V

Asa V : moribund patient, not expected to survive without surgery.

choices.text: Due to the effects of eye surgery

questions.text: A boy undergoes eye surgery under day care anesthesia with succinyl choline and propofol and after 8 hours he starts walking and develops muscle pain. What is the cause?
questions.solution:
Correct Answer (C)

Succinyl choline 

This is most probably postoperative myalgia associated with succinyl choline. Myalgia: Postoperative skeletal muscle pain, which is particularly prominent in the skeletal muscles of the neck, side and abdomen can occur. Most possible cause of unsynchronized contraction of skeletal muscle (fasciculation).

questions.text: A patient is undergoing MRND for laryngeal malignancy while dissecting the venous tributaries the surgeon elevated the internal jugular vein for ligation. Suddenly the patient's EtCO2 dropped from 38 mm Hg to 12 mm Hg and the patient developed hypotension along with cardiac arrhythmia. Which of the following is most likely cause?
questions.solution:
Correct Answer (C)


Venous air embolism (VAE), a subset of gas embolism, is an entity with the potential for severe morbidity and mortality. It is a predominantly iatrogenic that occurs when atmospheric gas is introduced into the systemic venous system.

questions.text: During surgery after inhalational anesthesia a patient suddenly developed fever, increased heart rate and BP, acidosis, and arrhythmia. What will be your line of management?
questions.solution:
Correct Answer (A)

Administer IV dantrolene
Sudden development of fever, tachycardia, hypertension, arrhythmia and acidosis after inhalational anesthesia (most probably halogenated drug) or succinyl choline suggest an episode of malignant hyperthermia. Treatment include immediately stopping the triggering agent and administering dantrolene.

choices.text: Binding to sodium channels and causing their inactivation

questions.text: Mechanism of Action of local anaesthetics?
questions.solution:
Correct Answer (D)

Binding to sodium channels and causing their inactivation

Local anesthetics bind a specific region of the α subunit and inhibit voltage-gated Na channels, preventing channel activation and inhibiting the Na influx associated with membrane depolarization.

questions.text: A 40-year-old male was brought to the casualty with multiple stab injuries over the abdomen. He was immediately prepared for emergency surgery and an endotracheal tube was inserted. Following intubation, capnography was performed, and end-tidal CO2 was detected. But his oxygen saturation dropped to 60 and there were no breath sounds audible over the left hemithorax. This is probably because of.
questions.solution:
Correct Answer (C)

Endobronchial intubation

Detection of end-tidal CO₂ but dropping oxygen saturation and hypoxia with absent breath sounds over the left hemithorax point to endobronchial intubation into the right main bronchus. Endobronchial intubation is first indicated by a sudden rise in peak inspiratory pressure.

choices.text: Perform a blind finger sweep to remove the food particle.

questions.text: A man was eating food at a restaurant and suddenly started choke on the food. He was not able to verbalize and soon became unresponsive. what will be the next step in the management?
questions.solution:
Correct Answer (C)


CHOKING IN ADULTS ( > 1 YEAR OLD)
Choking is a preventable cause of death that occurs when food or another object gets stuck in the throat. The airway gets blocked and immediate action is needed. The person typically only has a few minutes before they pass out. The universal sign of choking is holding the neck with one or both hands.
